website_summaries.verdict: A nicely fitting solar cover for above-ground pools, but it doesn’t hold up to chlorine and UV rays.
pros: Fits frame pools and Easy Set above-ground pools very well, with no trimming needed if ordered to size
cons: Cover can disintegrate after just a few months, scattering blue dots all over the bottom of the pool

customer_reviews.title: Works great fixed holders to take on and off the pool
customer_reviews.text: Works great fixed holders to take on and off the pool !! Laid it on the ground one day. And it burnt all my grass😩
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: too large for Intex Easy Set pool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 18ft cover for my 18ft Intex Easy Set pool. The cover is about 2ft too big for my pool. An 18ft Intex Easy Set pool is actually about 15.5ft at the top due to the bell bottom design of this pool. If you have an Easy Set pool, measure the opening at the top before you purchase. Other than the size the product looks like it will do as intended, but i haven't had it long enough yet to feel the effect of warmer water.
customer_reviews.author: jmg

customer_reviews.title: Even in Alaska, this cover heats the pool and keeps bugs out!
customer_reviews.text: I’m am surprised how well this cover works!! I was hopeful but skeptical, but it’s made a huge difference in our pool temp! We live in Alaska, and the hose water to fill our pool is ICE cold. Last year, it never got warm enough for me to swim even once. This year, with the cover, the water is so nice and warm, it’s incredible! We also had a terrible problem last year with tons of dead flies in the pool. The cover has the added bonus of keeping the vast majority of bugs and debris out!
customer_reviews.author: Homeschool Mama

customer_reviews.title: Ok but bubbles come off in pool
customer_reviews.text: We have been using ours consistently for about 3 months and it's falling apart. It does keep the p warmer. It easily adds 15-20 degrees. BUT in the last two weeks or so, it's been starting to rip and dry out. The worst part is the little bubbles are coming off everywhere. So, when we take it off we have to clean them all out of the pool every time. It's a cheap way to heat the pool but I guess it's going to mean buying a new one every season. Hopefully we can stretch this one another month.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Kosoff

customer_reviews.title: Wow...  but then it falls apart
customer_reviews.text: It fits my Coleman Power Steel Swim Vista series 2, 18x48. It fits with a little overage. It raised the pool temperature by 5 degrees in a day! I was amazed. When I took it off, I could feel the difference between the top of the water and further down. I couldn't believe it. Update - a month later, the cover still works great. I would recommend creating a clean place for it when it's not on the pool. UPDATE - at the end of the season the cover was ripping all over the place. First at the seams and then anywhere you would grab. Will have to purchase a new one. SUCKS.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated
customer_reviews.text: i actually really liked it at first it worked fantastic for warming the pool and light weight so my preteen could easily take it on and off. However, we do live in Vegas and the sun is intense here but in 3 months time it totally disintegrated. went to take it off one day and just totally fell apart. Little plastic bubble pieces everywhere and every time we touched it it would just rip, We kept it on daily to keep debris from neighboring trees out of the water. It would stay on for a few days a week without removal. I knew it wouldn't last forever but thought i would at least get one season out of it.
customer_reviews.author: cab

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s the middle of May and not summer temperatures yet. The water has averaged around 78. Within a day the water was 90 degrees on a 75 degree (outside) day. I wish it was easier to maneuver but I think it’s just the size and I’m short. I wish there was something for this product to roll it up like with inground pools. Very pleased! I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: H. Longley

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We've bought a new solar cover for our pool every year and kept it on year-round. It keeps the water clean and does a great job insulating. This year, the quality was terrible. Our pool is full of small blue circles of plastic as the "bubble wrap" falls apart. The price is 4 times as much as it was 3 months ago, so replacing it would be costly - and I don't know whether it would last any longer, so considering trying to build my own...
customer_reviews.author: Jaxonia

customer_reviews.title: Really Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I love this cover! It makes a noticeable difference in the water temperature. When you take the cover off you can feel the first few inches of water is much warmer. Once you get in the pool the warmth gets disbursed but it still feels much nice, especially now before it gets too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Jennine

customer_reviews.title: Does the job! **UPDATE** Did the job
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE** I was hoping to get at least the season out of this but after two months it started to disintegrate. We've tried to be careful with it because it's so thin, but it's been falling apart since the last week of August. Don't waste your $$ on this one, pay a few bucks more for the thicker cover. Original review: Don’t expect it to last more than one season because it is very thin. HOWEVER, it does a GREAT job warming up our pool and keeping debris to a minimum. The edge on this one wasn’t sewn on very well so is coming off in places otherwise I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ratti

customer_reviews.title: You have to get a new one each year
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 of these covers. They are made like bubble wrap. They only last for one summer. It works okay for heating the pool. It heats the top water to about 1 foot then you have to run the pump to mix that with the rest of the pool water. I stored each cover properly but when trying to use it the second season, it starts to fall apart. The bubbles break and the pieces come off and get into the filter. The cover tears easily when pulled.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona D

customer_reviews.title: It absolutely works
customer_reviews.text: We have an above ground pool and when We are done swimming for the day we put this cover on the pool instead of a big bulky cover. It can be put on and taken off by one person and you can be inside or outside of the pool when using. The cover keeps warmth in and also warms the water while on. We are 110% happy with this product which fits our above ground pool perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Keep it in place with a bungee!
customer_reviews.text: My pool went from 79 degrees to a super comfortable 86 degrees in 2 days! Every time the breeze blew, and it often does as I live near the ocean in Florida, the cover would blow off the edge. Although the manufacturer recommends tucking the edge of the cover in the pool, I pulled it over the edge and then used a bungee on my 18' round Intex easy set. The bungee cords and stretchy rope keep to create a pocket of hot air around the edges. Also, keeps the debris out. This product does what it says. I have pictures but not way to share.
customer_reviews.author: Christian R.

customer_reviews.title: The sun beats on it and breaks down the top layer of the product and it starts pulling all apart rendering it useless. It lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am giving this a 1 star is because it doesn't last. The sun beats on it and breaks down the top layer of the product and it starts pulling all apart rendering it useless. It lasted 2 months. While it was in good shape it worked wonderfully to heat the pool, I just want to invest in something that will last longer then 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Porter

customer_reviews.title: Only good for a few months
customer_reviews.text: Have bought several of these covers over the past 3 years. Each time we find the same thing, the cover lasts about 3-4 months then starts falling apart. If you call the manufacturer you get nowhere. In sum, these covers are great for holding in heat in your pool and are cost-effective as long as you understand you will have to throw it away in a few months. If you're looking for a longer term solution, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Best Diner in America

customer_reviews.title: Works great, initially.
customer_reviews.text: This solar cover fits my Intex 18ft round pool perfectly. It's fairly easy to pull on and off by myself, but helps if you have 2-3 people. However, midway through it's 2nd season of use and being hammered by the sun/rain etc. its starting to tear in spots specifically when removing and even occasionally while putting back on. I expected it to last for 3-5 summers but it looks like I will need to replace after only 2. If you're ok with replacing every couple summers then go for it, 'cuz it definitely keeps the water warm on those cooler nights. Quality/durability is lacking a bit overall though.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Paddock

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for a couple of pools now and we have always liked the results. You’ll get at least 10-20 degrees of warmer water with them. Some reviews mention that they don’t last and they don’t keep debris out. They aren’t designed to keep debris out or bugs but hit helps and between the chlorine and UV from the sun, it’s true you’ll only get 3-4 years of life before the plastic degrades. But considering the price that’s an operating cost of about $10 a year and you won’t get that top of cost with any other heater.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Was worried after seeing bad reviews but decided to take a chance. Quality is great, easy to unpack and put onto the pool alone. Kids removed it and stored on deck easily. Have used for approximately 2 weeks but no temperature change. It doesnt seem to help heat it up even the smallest degree but does help block leaves and suck from pool. Over all would recommend for use.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Full of holes
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in a large plastic carrier type bag. The kind something like a large comforter would come in. When I unfollowed it the solar cover was full of these holes. I then inspected the bag it came in and there was the same type of hole in it. It literally is in a pattern. Like someone took a drill clear though the bag and solar cover. I am so disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Darrowland

customer_reviews.title: It works great BUT.
customer_reviews.text: But it is only one year later and it is falling apart the plastics did not hold up well in the soft Oregon sun and standard pool chemicals. The top layer is peeling like a bad sunburn and rest of it will easley rip if you even think about try to pull on it. So for a replacement I went with Thermo-Tex 2831818 from Amazon, come with a 3 Year manufacturer’s limited Warranty for what that is worth. Hopefully thermo-tex last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I wonder if anyone commenting here kept this for more then 9 months? Mine literally disintegrated. It flakes off and rips as wet paper literally. I'm actually wondering now if there are a ton of fake reviews here, I can't be the only one noticing it.
customer_reviews.author: Gen Holliday

customer_reviews.title: solar bubbles pop -
customer_reviews.text: the solar bubbles on this pool cover tend to pop when exposed to the elements. Vendor does not warranty against the solar bubbles popping, the solar blanket for a pool is used outside, I don't understand why vendor will not warranty the use of solar blanket when it's been exposed to the elements. Where else would you use it - it's for a swimming pool, which is outside. Also, the seams tend to come apart after a few months -
customer_reviews.author: Su Ober

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The cover worked great the first couple months. Warmed the water. Easily covered the pool surface but it became very brittle. The back of the bubbles started coming off and littered the pool with hundreds of small plastic pieces. It would also rip very easily when pulling the cover off. We needed up ripping a hole too big to ignore and tossed it.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Condition of Product on receipt
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was prompt. I appreciate that as I am busy and was in an immediate need of the cover. When we removed the cover form the box there were several small torn holes about half an inch in diameter. Despite the holes we did not bother to send it back. This cover has been the best cover I have ever had for solar heat absorption. I hope the holes do not affect its life expectancy.
customer_reviews.author: Clate

customer_reviews.title: Triple the price ?????
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my 18 foot pool last year for 43 dollars didnt make it but 1 year . Started ripping and was super brittle almost like it was dry rotted ... Now because of the pandemic they wanna sell it for triple the price ... i wouldnt mind spending 43 dollars again for it to last another year but not gonna spend 130 for something i already know isnt going to last . Other companys sell some with warrenties much rather go that route.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Lasts only a few months
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this cover in May 2020 and by August 2020 the cover was disintegrating. My filter had blue circles about the size of a fingertip all over and floating around the pool. I called and text and they said that cover was known for only lasting a few months. I thought this covert would last a few seasonsI Purchased this cover in May 2020 and by August the cover was disintegrating. My filter had blue circles about the size of a fingertip all over and flowing around the pool. I called and text and they said that cover was known for only lasting a few months. I thought this cover would last a few season
customer_reviews.author: Jakemir

customer_reviews.title: Good solar cover for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent solar cover overall, warms the pool and keeps most contaminants out. Can be set in or removed by one person. One drawback: lasts about 1 season. By the end of the summer ours was falling apart and tearing. I suppose months of sun exposure degrades the material. Leaves little blue plastic bits everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: P.Ronn

customer_reviews.title: .works well but bulky to use
customer_reviews.text: To keep my pool warmer longer into late summer and fall in Michigan. I leave it on all the time when pool is not in use or being shocked. It is somewhat bulky and heavy to manuever for a smaller person but not a taller, stronger person as they stand higher above the pool. If you have a roller it would solve that, but I don't and I doubt they are made for an 18 foot above ground cover. I cut mine in 3, which makes it more manageable and does not affect the function. It was inexpensive and worth the money even if it only lasts one season for me.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M.

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrating after 3 Months
customer_reviews.text: We loved our old solar cover, but after 3 years of use, it needed replaced. So I bought this one. It worked perfectly at first. However, after only 3 months of use, the edges are disintegrating! It just shreds in your hands when you try to put it on or off, and it is leaving little blue plastic dots and chunks of the cover in my pool. It is September though, so we have to use it or we can't use our pool. This is the same brand we had before, so I'm not sure why the drastic difference in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sara L.

customer_reviews.title: Basic Junk
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in April of this year. It's now mid-July and it has basically disintegrated in the pool. I know it's the cheapest one on Amazon, but not it you have to buy two to three of them a year. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this product. Go with the heavier ones for around $60. We got two full summers out of the last one we had.
customer_reviews.author: M. Story

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing solar cover
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd solar pool cover. The first one lasted 2 summers in Wisconsin. This one is already complete Trash, filling my pool with little blue dots of plastic! It has only been on the pool for less than 4 months! Very disappointed and it is too late to return now.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Baker at BobbiesJoy

customer_reviews.title: Received with holes in it
customer_reviews.text: 3/4 inch holes every foot or so in a circle mid-way between the center and the edge. I would give 5 stars otherwise. I have called Intex service line twice. 1st time was at 4pm PDT. Message said to call back during business hours which are to 5pm PDT. Called today at 1:10. Message said essentially they are too busy to take my call. Too bad I can't give negative stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: M Gregory

customer_reviews.title: A solar product that isn't UV resistant!?!?!?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last June. Gently used all summer, stored indoors dry throughout the winter. Put it on the pool this spring and it started molting all of the blue dots off. Terrible! So disappointed that a product made to lay in the sun is apparently made from non UV resistant polymer material.... will not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Warms the water perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad we purchased the solar blanket. It works just as anticipated; it warms the water perfectly while keeping debris and pests out of the water making pool maintenance much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: This warms the water, helps keep debris out, and stops evaporation loss. I push it to the side and run straps around it to swim. I wish it had something to cover the edges. All the leaves blow in there. I’d pay more for some sort of elastic piece added to go up and over the edges.
customer_reviews.author: worker bee

customer_reviews.title: Worth every $!
customer_reviews.text: Truly surprised! I didn’t know how much to expect for essentially a bubble wrap thermal blanket- but for $40 was worth a try. Worth every dollar! Can’t believe how quickly it warmed the pool, after only a couple days of mid 80s. Also, it really helps prevent so much debris from getting in pool. As others have mentioned it seems to make my chlorine stay at a more consistent level. Now when we get to upper 90s-100s it probably won’t help as much but that’s ok by me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Four months of use and it is disintegrating to a point of failure. The pre punched holes permit water to get onto top of cover when folding for removal thus inevitably returning dirty water to the pool when folded back. This is a total hassle as it also increases the weight of the cover dragging it down further to allow more water on to the top of the cover with other pre punched holes. Had I known before it ever was put on I might have taped over the holes. Regardless, the pool cover is a -partial one season-waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Holes!
customer_reviews.text: This was the highest recommended solar pool cover. as soon as I started unfolding it I see holes everywhere not just one I didn't even get it completely unfolded and so about 15 holes I don't know if I got a bad batch I sure hope others don't experience this I was ready to start heating up the pool now I've got to wait for another one to come. Frustrated😠
customer_reviews.author: Nana P.

customer_reviews.title: Great cover to protect and to heat up!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! It really works. It takes some time to hear up, but after 2 days it went up about 7 degrees with some sun and it doesn't go down when it's cold out! It's also thick so it seems like it will last a good amount of time. Lastly, the holes are there on PURPOSE. The cover is MEANT to have holes on it!
customer_reviews.author: Sonia L.

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated before one year mark
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pool cover approximately 6-7 months. I went to take it off this past weekend and it has totally disintegrated. I pulled it off in pieces. If I had to pull with even the slightest resistance at all, it ripped. I have never had a solar cover do this before. Hoping to find one that lasts longer than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is absolutely horrible. I've had it for only 3 month and almost a quarter of the cells broke down, contaminating the pool with small vinyl circles. Every day i find more and more vinyl pieces in the water. I've had Intex cover a few years ago and it held for more than a year. This one is much, much worse.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Dolphin

customer_reviews.title: Not durable, good for one season at most.
customer_reviews.text: The cover lasted for three months is all. Then it completely began desinigrating and split down the middle. Blue chunks of plastic have broken off and you can’t handle it at all without the plastic ripping and shreadding everywhere. I was very surprised that this didn’t even last two swimming seasons in a pool that’s only up a few months a year. I’ll be buying a better cover next time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: 2 small holes, other than that, seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: Appears to work great. I placed it in my pool by myself so it’s definitely easy to maneuver. I did notice it came with two small holes. It’s not that big a deal, as far as the product working. It is troubling that I paid for a cover that’s a little damaged. I’ll keep it. It’s not a big enough problem to go through the trouble of sending it back
customer_reviews.author: Shop2much

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I saw a few bad reviews and I have loved using this. No issues with delivery and it works well. I just pull it on and off and have had to rips
customer_reviews.author: Kat Green

customer_reviews.title: This one is so much better. We have severe storms here
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several different covers and they were bulky, hard to clean and hard to get in and out. This one is so much better. We have severe storms here, this prevented sticks and other debris from getting in the pool and it protects the birds from drowning. I could not be happier with this. It is easy to use and install and it sort of floats out and adjusts itself, it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my Doughboy 18' round pool!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Doughboy 18' round pool. Seems to be good quality (I mean, I did just receive it today and put it in my pool.) Its a busy time of year, so nobody local had 18' round solar covers in stock but of course, Amazon does. I dont even care that it says "Intex" on it, I needed something to warm up my pool and keep the leaves/bugs/bird poop out.
customer_reviews.author: Technologic80

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: If you have one of the round InTex above ground pools you absolutely need one of these covers. They work amazingly well at heating the pool water simply from the sun, while keeping debris out of the water.. I purchased this one as a gift for my father-in-law who has the 18 foot pool. We also own a smaller one for our 15 foot InTex pool.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Peterson

customer_reviews.title: This thing worked for 2 months maybe?
customer_reviews.text: It deteriorated in my pool, chlorine levels are fine, but unless you want little blue dots everywhere do not buy this. I paid 40 bucks for it and did not expect it to last so i guess it met my expectations..... I spent 2 hours cleaning my pump, skimmer, and pool lines.... Tried to fill out the warranty but the site is incredibly broken, you cant upload your receipt, and they just tell you everything is past warranty. This lasted less than 90 days. Buy it as a temporary solution MAYBE at the sale price of $40. DO NOT PAY 140!
customer_reviews.author: Collin Lesko

customer_reviews.title: Deflated solar cover - the best thay could do?
customer_reviews.text: The bubbles are all deflated. It meets all other expectations, but it must have been produced at a low altitude, and when it arrived in Colorado, the pressure did not support the inflation. After a short season, the top was losing lots of its cover, and none of the bubbles were inflated. It was not abused or anything. This is the worst I've had in 35 years. It worked marginally, but we won't get a second season out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Al Dagel, Pueblo, CO

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to put in and out of the pool, keeps water from cooling, catches most leaves and bugs
customer_reviews.text: It is super easy to use, unlike the winter cover. It warms the pool up fast after days of heavy rain. Catches tree debris, bugs, etc, so I don't have as much work with the net and vacuum. Took a while to help the pool warm in the spring, but it helped!
customer_reviews.author: A. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Seems to help the water temps
customer_reviews.text: So far we are happy with this solar cover - our first try at something like this. It fits well in in our 15 ft round pool. One person can pull it off, but it's hard to get back on unless you have 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy K.

customer_reviews.title: Will Warm up your water for sure
customer_reviews.text: Best thing we bought for our pool, water heat up to 100 degrees like a jacuzzi🤣but you can control that by removing the cover but we just leave it all day to create that sensation of been on a jacuzzi. Overall is awesome no more cold water for the kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Fantauzzi

customer_reviews.title: A must for warm pool water
customer_reviews.text: Significantly increased water temperature within a couple of days. I like that pumps can still run with the cover on and it stays on in KANSAS wind! Cover is cumbersome to remove and put on the pool -one person can do it, better with two. To protect the cover when off, we put it in a plastic wheel barrow and store in the garage, out of the sun.
customer_reviews.author: swksmom

customer_reviews.title: amazing difference
customer_reviews.text: thoroughly impressed with the temperature difference this has made to extend our swim season earlier and later in the year. a LARGE outdoor garbage can makes an easy by the pool storage for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer & John Williamson

customer_reviews.title: 18 FT ROUND INTEX POOL
customer_reviews.text: FITS MY 18FT ROUND BLOW UP RING ON THE TOP INTEX POOL PERFECT. THERE IS ABOUT 3 INCHES OF OVERLAP AROUND THE PERIMETER SO YOU JUST FOLD IT DOWN IN THE WATER AND WORKS GOOD.
customer_reviews.author: Novy

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: We bought a bargain brand one three years ago and it lasted two years despite a five year warranty. We figured our intense sun here in Southwest Texas made that a fair enough lifespan. We thought we would give the Intex Brand one a shot since it was a name brand instead of a bargain brand. It did not last but three months. Now our pool is filled with the blue circles from the bubbles falling apart. Almost 1/3 of the bubbles have failed at this point. Very disappointed and having trouble getting Intex to refund our money or replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 9 HOLES!  Updated 10-16-19
customer_reviews.text: The pool cover was exactly what I needed, however, it had a quarter-sized hole punched through several layers of it. It works but I wonder how long it will last. Very disappointed. Don't buy this! It has fallen apart & disintegrated as I removed it from my pool after 3 months of mild usage. What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight easy to handle.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about how lightweight this cover was compared to our previous one. I figured it wouldn't do the job. I am impressed with how well it heats and how much easier it is to remove being as light as it is.
customer_reviews.author: Liv2RideHD

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS AN AWESOME BUY! fits our pool perfectly, its light enough i can cover the pool all by myself and it keeps the temp a comfortable 70 , hotter if we have a really warm week. We should have bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara McClellan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 2 months!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a worthless purchase. I bought this one the end of June and set up the pool the first week of July by the beginning of August it was in bad shape but by mid august it was in pieces. My last one lasted for 2 full summers. SUPER DISAPPOINTED!!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of Many

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second year that we purchased this item. Last year it suddenly started disintegrating. I assumed it was just a fluke. I ordered again in May and again it has begun disintegrating. There is no warning when it does this, it happenes very suddenly and makes a mess to skim from the pool. We will not order again for that reason alone. It does keep the water warm so it does perform its intended function. It just doesn't have a long life.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend this at all!!
customer_reviews.text: When I took the solar cover out of the bag there are round holes all through the cover about the size of a cigar. We didn't continue counting after 5, I just called Amazon and told them about it so I can just return it and get my money back. We did notice that the actual cover size is in fact 17' round, not 18' so it will more than likely float around in circles inside your 18' round pool instead of fitting properly. All in all I definitely do NOT recommend buying this solar cover!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a little too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use on above ground saltwater pool. Definitely works well. In the desert Southwest, heats the pool water up to bath temperature. Not so easy to remove/reinstall. And after using for 2 months it has become brittle and has started to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Darold G.

customer_reviews.title: The Jury Is In but went back for final Judgement..
customer_reviews.text: The Jury Is In, this is a thin solar blanket and won't last long. I'm sure it will warm my pool just fine I just don't expect it to last more than 2 seasons. Update; I waited till my last blanket fell apart to use this one. Stitched seams and edge. really nice detail. Also I think the quarter size holes are intended to let the bubble out, interesting idea. It fits inside my 18' round Doughboy nicely. I wish the material was a little thicker but all in all I like this product more than my first review. I bumping up my rating to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: tailu66

customer_reviews.title: Good Cover
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought 2 of these. They seem to dry rot pretty quickly but work great for a year or 2.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Solar heats the pool really well
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It keeps most the dirt and bugs out. It also heats the pool so well it was 96 degrees in the evening after a 105 degree day. So maybe it works a little to well haha.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 months and literally fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this last May, it lasted 3 months then completely disintegrated. It fell apart in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Momo4

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put on pool bubbles down and heated. depth of heated water depends on how hot and how long sun is out which is common sense. Very happy it warms it up some for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, do not understand the bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: Works just like described, really helps keep the heat in overnight. I use a black poly tubing as a solar heater with this, I can get my pool to any temperature I desire.
customer_reviews.author: SMCohen

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Boy what a mixed bag of reviews on this product! Some people saying it works, doesn't work, keeps debris out, doesn't keep it out.... Personally I couldn't see any change in the overall mean temperature of the pool. (and I took mine off during the day and put it back on at night) What I did notice was a definite reduction in the amount of chlorine I was using. (at least 50% less) and I also felt like I was vacuuming the pool less often. BUT WHAT A PAIN! Take it off, put it on, take it off, put it on. It's just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Yo daddy

customer_reviews.title: As expected...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd cover like this . they only last maybe 3 years if you are lucky. Helps keep debris out of my pool and helps the water get a bit warmer. Not a problem in the hot summer we are having in Central MN.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette J.

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest in the pack.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Works as intended Con: Only lasted a year If you're only looking for a summer of use, this one is for you. If you like to clean out little blue specs of plastic then this is for you. I'll be trying another brand this year. Hopefully it will last more than 1 summer.
customer_reviews.author: R. H.

customer_reviews.title: Update end of season
customer_reviews.text: Had an inground pool for 20 years. This is the best solar cover we have ever gotten. the edges are sewn so they don't tare. And it is true to size. Addendum 08/30/2018 Did not last a season. falling apart. little round pieces all over the pool. Looked great for about a mo. than started falling apart
customer_reviews.author: Trekie mom

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to heat the pool and keep litter out but unfortunately after about 2 1/2 months the bubble covers on the top of the cover started coming off in hoards.
customer_reviews.author: debbien

customer_reviews.title: Great for a month, then disintegrates.
customer_reviews.text: I received this in May and by late June it was starting to deteriorate in the pool. By July it is of no further use as it comes apart like spider webbing with a bare, gentle touch. Calling the listed support line gets a message that says call volume is too high and to call back as your call will not be accepted. Worked great for the first month, then died.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Looked like a nice cover but didn’t let 3 years and it does not have a warranty
customer_reviews.text: Cover hasn’t made it through its 3rd year yet and it is falling apart. I bought it because of its 10 year warranty but when I called to get it warranties they said the warranty cover would cost me $5 less than what I originally paid. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Love this cover
customer_reviews.text: This is like heavy duty bubble wrap for the pool water. two days on my pool and the water is still clean as all heck. Tomorrow we swim and test out the water. This was well worth the price. The cover that came with the pool was not manageable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: It really work's
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for about two weeks now and i love it. I live in nc and have trees in my yard and the pool gets about 4 to 5 hours of sun a day. I just went to check on my auto pool vac and the tep was 89 at 9:00 pm the highest i have ever seen it. We have the cover on whenever we are not in the pool. I all so made a holder for it out of pvc pipe something i got off of YouTube you can take it on and off with one person with this.
customer_reviews.author: Old yellow

customer_reviews.title: Made our water so warm and it's easy to put on and off
customer_reviews.text: This has been the nicest cover. Made our water so warm and it's easy to put on and off. It never blows off or sinks and has withstood kansas winds and storms!! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warms up water fast
customer_reviews.text: Warms up the water fast. Our pool only gets sun like 4 hours a day. Before this it never got above 70. Today it was 76 in the pool and the weather was 76. Not bad
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: No way to secure
customer_reviews.text: Solar cover. Just barely covers our 18' diameter EasySet pool. Instructions say to tuck edges underneath ring on pool to secure it, but cover is not big enough to accomplish this. It's still better than no cover, but I wish we could secure it somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Jordana Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Cover arrived and it was exactly what I expected..I have the 18 foot round pool and I really could have gotten away with the next size down..if you look at the pic.. there are lots of wrinkles in it and I think it could actually fit a 20 round pool..If you can not affluent this size you will be just fine with the size under this and get the same results
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone severely downhill. Falling apart!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality/lifespan. Not even 3 months into using this cover, more than half the “bubbles” have disintegrated and are now throughout our pool and pump. This cover has been taken care of properly, almost to an extreme. These covers used to be great, the quality has evidently gone severely down hill. Will not be purchasing Intex covers anymore. Warranty only lasts 30 days, evidently for a reason. Huge waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yendra

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: Bought at the beginning of May and less than three months later it has completely fallen apart. See pic. Can’t even use anymore. The little blue circles are all coming off and causing problems with our filter as well as littering our property with little plastic circles.
customer_reviews.author: Kasaundra Ray

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the heat in
customer_reviews.text: This really helped our above ground pool! It kept the heat in and helped keep the bugs and stuff out of the pool. Only downside is I hope it lasts a few summers because after a few months of using I Have noticed some of the bubbles have popped here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Faron  Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 4 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought it in April and it is August and the bubble plastic is coming apart and clogging our filter screen. We have a reel and out pool is well maintained, I do not know why this didn't last. very disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product at the right price the quality is better ...
customer_reviews.text: great product at the right price the quality is better than most solar covers and has a so cloth edging that helps secure naturally to the swim pool sides an amazing job love it thank you Amazon & Intex for making your product stand out and stand out loud and proud, my pool stays at 80° or higher looking forward to a longer guaranteed swim season as always
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works great, can be made small to store for the day, and keeps the leaves and seeds out all night. Do not leave on grass, as it will kill it faster than you think.
customer_reviews.author: Dalia J.

customer_reviews.title: It definitely warms the water
customer_reviews.text: No doubt that this thing works. I live in the south where it storms every late afternoon, which makes the water cold. If I put this cover on and give it a few hours of sunshine in the morning it warms the water about a foot down so that it feels like bathwater.
customer_reviews.author: Minnie Whitt

customer_reviews.title: Love the brand; durable and affordable product
customer_reviews.text: It’s just what you would expect from a pool cover. Durable to last as long as it’s treated properly; it is essentially bubble wrap. Makes a noticeable 2-4 degrees difference on hot days and traps the heat in well during the night.
customer_reviews.author: Just T

customer_reviews.title: 1 Season/Year Solar cover
customer_reviews.text: 18' Round Abovegroynd cover. Took two being delivered, as 1st was damaged. Edging is seamed. This model is basically a one season/year solar pool cover, as the outer, sunside plastic started deteriorating and leaving film on pool. Did keep pool a good 5 degrees warmer and cut water evaporation dramatically. Replaced with another brand as it advertises 3 season/year cover, but with higher price
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great asset to our pool! This cover fits nicely over the water without having to pull it and tie it over the edge....and it's so easy to pull over the water. It looks like bubble wrap on the bottom, but it works great and can feel the difference in our pool temperature. When we had storms and heavy rain, the cover did not sink or move around the pool.....so it kept all the dirt and leaves out and we could get in after the storms...to a nice warm pool. I am highly impressed with this Intex Solar Cover!
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: 3 months and it fell apart
customer_reviews.text: last one was great for 3 years, this one started shedding little pieces of plastic everywhere , had to daily clean skimmer as it caused a drop in water pressure, it now has ripped throughout. removed on weekends to swim. do not buy, JUNK
customer_reviews.author: t lambert

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Before opening the product (since it’s in clear packaging) I could see many holes in the solar cover. It was either missing “bubbles” or holes up to 2 inches in size. I sent it back for a full refund and didn’t bother trying to reorder a new one.
customer_reviews.author: JCEDGE

customer_reviews.title: Price Gouging!
customer_reviews.text: Paid $40 3 months ago. Just want to echo everything else others have sharedas well. 3 months and it has fallen apart. Ordered in the beginning of May and now it is the beginning of August. It is disintegrating.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: This was the biggest piece of crap I have ever purchased! It didn't even last one season. The only reason I gave it one star is because you have to rate it to leave a review! I wish I could have given it a negative number!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE - the little bubbles deflate and it sinks in the pool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a little over 1 month ago and have used it for about a month. At first it seemed to be working great and then 1 week ago I noticed that it was not staying afloat on top of the water. We took it off and over 50% of the little bubbles that are supposed to be filled with air - have deflated. This is now useless - Hopefully INTEX or the seller will get ahold of me and offer to replace it for FREE. - Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: bones

customer_reviews.title: Deteriorated after a season and a half
customer_reviews.text: We live in the inland northwest and use our pool for 4 months a year. This cover was stored indoors in the offseason. It only lasted in total for 6 months of usage before it deteriorated as others mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Thing rotted away in 3months, tried to call.. But hold, hold, hold your life away... Out of the 90 period... I have been had
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: I have had this cover for over a week. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this cover for over a week. I can definitely tell a difference in the temperature (at least the first few inches of water), because my pool was just put up. The pool is in a shady area and the water was almost miserably cold for my son. I do think this cover has helped. My only critique is I wish it was a little larger in diameter to actually secure over the sides of the pool to help keep debri out. It tends to float just enough that leaves and sticks can get in around it.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Ammons

product_meta.title: Intex Solar Cover for 18ft Diameter Easy Set and Frame Pools
product_meta.description:
Intex Krystal Clear 18-Foot Solar Pool Cover



Product Measures: 18.9 x 13.39 x 22.83 IN



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Intex krystal clear solar cover 18'. Helps keep water warmer. Easy to use. Includes carry bag for storage when not in use. Fits just inside edge of pool and floats in place. Lighweight material
feature_bullets: Includes a reusable carry bag for storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,843 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
